Name: Wooden figure of a cat
Description: Crudely modelled wooden figure of a cat, from Saqqara. The figure probably dates to the Late Period or later. The cat appears in Egyptian iconography as a means of depicting the goddess Bastet, but also in the Book of the Dead as a form of the sun-god Re. At the desert edge at Saqqara, there was a temple of Bastet with catacombs containing vast numbers of mummified cats.
